009package imagingbook.common.filter.generic;
010
011import imagingbook.common.image.PixelPack;
012
013/**
014 * <p>
015 * This (abstract) class represents a filter which treats all pixel data as vectors. The filter calls the method
016 * {@code doPixel(PixelPack, int, int)} for each image pixel, which must be implemented by any concrete sub-class.
017 * </p>
018 * <p>
019 * Thus a custom filter based on this class only needs to specify the steps to be performed for a single pixel. The
020 * remaining filter mechanics including multiple components, out-of-bounds coordinate handling, multiple passes and data
021 * copying are handled by this class and its super-class (see {@link GenericFilter}).
022 * </p>
023 */
024public abstract class GenericFilterVector extends GenericFilter {
025
026        private int iter = 0;
027        private int iterMax = 1;        // for progress reporting only
028        
029        @Override 
030        protected void runPass(PixelPack sourcePack, PixelPack targetPack) {
031                final int width = sourcePack.getWidth();
032                final int height = sourcePack.getHeight();
033                iterMax = width * height;
034                iter = 0;
035                for (int v = 0; v < height; v++) {
036                        for (int u = 0; u < width; u++) {
037                                targetPack.setPix(u, v, doPixel(sourcePack, u, v)); // single pixel operation
038                                iter++;
039                        }
040                }
041                iter = 0;
042        }
043        
044        /**
045         * This method defines the steps to be performed for a single image pixel and
046         * must be implemented by any concrete sub-class.
047         * The source data are passed as a {@link PixelPack} container, which
048         * holds the pixel values of all image components.
049         * The method {@link PixelPack#getPix(int, int)} should be used to read
050         * individual pixel vectors. These data should not be modified but
051         * the (float[]) result of the single-pixel calculation must be returned.
052         * Implementations are free to return the same float-array at each invocation,
053         * i.e., there is no need to allocate a new array every time.
054         * 
055         * @param source the vector-valued image data
056         * @param u the current x-position
057         * @param v the current y-position
058         * @return the result of the filter calculation for this pixel
059         */
060        protected abstract float[] doPixel(PixelPack source, int u, int v);
061        
062        // -----------------------------------------------------------------
063        
064        @Override
065        protected final double reportProgress(double subProgress) {
066                double localProgress = (double) iter /iterMax;
067                //System.out.println("GenericFilterVector: reportProgress() - returning " + localProgress);
068                return super.reportProgress(localProgress);
069        }
070
071}
